document_notes.text:
This update to Wireshark 1 12.11 fixes a number issues in protocol dissectors that could have allowed a remote attacker to crash Wireshark or cause excessive CPU usage through specially crafted packages inserted into the network or a capture file.

- The PKTC dissector could crash (wnpa-sec-2016-22)
- The PKTC dissector could crash (wnpa-sec-2016-23)
- The IAX2 dissector could go into an infinite loop (wnpa-sec-2016-24)
- Wireshark and TShark could exhaust the stack (wnpa-sec-2016-25) 
- The GSM CBCH dissector could crash (wnpa-sec-2016-26)
- The NCP dissector could crash (wnpa-sec-2016-28)
- CVE-2016-2523: DNP dissector infinite loop (wnpa-sec-2016-03)
- CVE-2016-2530: RSL dissector crash (wnpa-sec-2016-10)
- CVE-2016-2531: RSL dissector crash (wnpa-sec-2016-10)
- CVE-2016-2532: LLRP dissector crash (wnpa-sec-2016-11)
- GSM A-bis OML dissector crash (wnpa-sec-2016-14)
- ASN.1 BER dissector crash (wnpa-sec-2016-15)
- ASN.1 BER dissector crash (wnpa-sec-2016-18) 

Also containsfurther bug fixes and updated protocol support as listed in:
https://www.wireshark.org/docs/relnotes/wireshark-1.12.11.html 
https://www.wireshark.org/docs/relnotes/wireshark-1.12.10.html

notes.text: The dnp3_al_process_object function in epan/dissectors/packet-dnp.c in the DNP3 dissector in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.10 and 2.0.x before 2.0.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a crafted packet.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

product_id: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 11 SP4:wireshark-1.12.11-0.18.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 11 SP4:wireshark-1.12.11-0.18.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 11 SP4:wireshark-devel-1.12.11-0.18.1

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: The dissct_rsl_ipaccess_msg function in epan/dissectors/packet-rsl.c in the RSL dissector in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.10 and 2.0.x before 2.0.2 mishandles the case of an unrecognized TLV type, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a crafted packet, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-2531.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

product_id: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 11 SP4:wireshark-1.12.11-0.18.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 11 SP4:wireshark-1.12.11-0.18.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 11 SP4:wireshark-devel-1.12.11-0.18.1

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: Off-by-one error in epan/dissectors/packet-rsl.c in the RSL dissector in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.10 and 2.0.x before 2.0.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a crafted packet that triggers a 0xff tag value, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-2530.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

product_id: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 11 SP4:wireshark-1.12.11-0.18.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 11 SP4:wireshark-1.12.11-0.18.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 11 SP4:wireshark-devel-1.12.11-0.18.1

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: The dissect_llrp_parameters function in epan/dissectors/packet-llrp.c in the LLRP dissector in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.10 and 2.0.x before 2.0.2 does not limit the recursion depth, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption or application crash) via a crafted packet.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
